headline: Disney drags the Dow lower, Starbucks workers on strike
summary: Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma, Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal take a look at Thursday's market action. Disney (DIS) is dragging the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) lower. NBC Universal (CMCSA) is launching a new sports network on Monday. Unionized Starbucks (SBUX) workers in over 40 cities are walking out on strike. Watch the video above to learn more of Thursday's trending headlines. For full interviews, highlights, and key insights, check out more from Yahoo Finance Invest.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery just got a boost, and buyers are circling
summary: Investors did not see this coming, but Warner Bros. Discovery just started a new chapter. For a long time, the media behemoth was seen as a recovery story based on streaming and studio expansion. Now, it is at the heart of what may be the greatest entertainment shakeup of the year. headline: COMCAST AND COLUSA INDIAN COMMUNITY COUNCIL ANNOUNCE BROADBAND EXPANSION
summary: Cover Image SAN BRUNO WELCOMES FIRST XFINITY STORE Colusa, CA, Nov. 13, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Comcast and Colusa Indian Community Council announced expanded broadband service to homes and businesses located on tribal and non-tribal lands in and around the Tribe’s community campus. The planned expansion adds to Comcast’s more than $4 billion in technology and infrastructure investments across California in the past three years. This expansion is made possible by a $3.2 million Federal Funding

raw.headline: COMCAST AND COLUSA INDIAN COMMUNITY COUNCIL ANNOUNCE BROADBAND EXPANSION
raw.summary: Cover Image SAN BRUNO WELCOMES FIRST XFINITY STORE Colusa, CA, Nov. 13, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Comcast and Colusa Indian Community Council announced expanded broadband service to homes and businesses located on tribal and non-tribal lands in and around the Tribe’s community campus. The planned expansion adds to Comcast’s more than $4 billion in technology and infrastructure investments across California in the past three years. This expansion is made possible by a $3.2 million Federal Funding

headline: Comcast Opens New Xfinity Store in Noblesville, Expanding Access to Technology and In-Person Support
summary: Comcast has opened its newest Xfinity Store in Indiana, located in Noblesville. This new retail location is designed to serve as a local tech hub, offering residents and small business owners with convenient access to the latest Xfinity products, services, and personalized support.

headline: NBCUniversal Launching New Cable Sports Channel
summary: The new NBCSN channel will launch Monday and carry mostly sports that are also streamed on NBCU’s Peacock service, including NBA games, Big Ten college football, golf and Premier League soccer.

headline: 1 Profitable Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Ignore
